newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR STABLE TO FIRMER ON MAJOR UNITS.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR STABLE TO FIRMER ON MAJOR UNITS.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar was quoted stable to firmer against hard currencies in fairly quiet trade on Thursday morning, dealers said.

"The market is a bit on the quiet side at the moment. There was some import pressure earlier and rates were threatening to go up but the Reserve Bank came in with liquidity and their timing was right," a dealer commented.

At around 0815 GMT, the Zimbabwe dollar was trading at its overnight 10.6000/6200 against the U.S. dollar but edged up to 16.9210/9630 against sterling from 16.9390/9800, tracking a firmer U.S. dollar overseas.
It was at 6.9680/9830 from 6.9740/9870 against the mark and at 2.3130/3190 versus the rand, slightly up from 2.3170/3230 at Wednesday's close.
